 The prestigious Stanford mentoring program combined with funding for research teams that have an idea for a new therapy, potential drug, vaccine, diagnostic test, or other medical device. 

 Description 

SPARK Poland 
is funded by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education.
 The initiator and organizer of the program is 
the Marceli Nencki Institute of Experimental Biology, Polish Academy of Sciences (PAN).

In practice, this is a two-year, intensive, systematic mentoring program with experienced experts and practitioners, combined 
with access to funding for research experiments in the amount of 300,000 PLN.

The SPARK program develops 
scientific projects in the field of biomedicine towards implementation and commercialization.

The program is intended for researchers motivated by the idea of a specific biomedical solution.

The goal of SPARK Poland is to create a model mechanism for the national biotechnology sector, enabling us to transform ideas for biomedical inventions into applications.

The SPARK program is already operating in 21 countries worldwide, including 8 European countries: Switzerland, Germany, the United Kingdom, Denmark, Norway, Finland, Italy, and the Czech Republic.

The application deadline for ideas is March 20, 2025.
